messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:35): hmm. I have some weird reset insertion mode code for th and td
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:35): that makes a test fail
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:35): but that code cannot be there by accident
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:39): ok, I'm just impementing the spec...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:41): Why does this:
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:41): </table></tbody></tfoot></thead></tr><div>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:41): #document-fragment
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:41): expect this
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:41): Given step #3 in "reset the insertion mode"?

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:42): step 3 being If node is the first node in the stack of open elements, then set last to true; if, in addition, the context element of the HTML fragment parsing algorithm is neither a td element nor a th  element, then set node to the context element.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:47): svn blame blames ryansking
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:47): what else would make sense?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:48): (i haven't tried reading the spec for this though)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:48): not necessarily making sense, though
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:49): but step 3 in the spec sure look deliberate
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:49): isn't there some rule that scopes it to <body>?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:53): looks like I'm missing the 'last' flag
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:55): hmm. nope, step 15 is not it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:08): i'll take a look
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:08): having said that, i'm jetlagged
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:10): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, so it seems that from step 3 you end up at step 5
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:12): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: nope. 'node' is "html" at step 5
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:13): because it specifically did *not* get set to "td" in step 3
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:16): hmm, yeah, weird
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (15:16): ISO approved OOXML </offtopic>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:17): yeah...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:19): the OOXML "process" stinks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:19): pretending that it is a voting process and then carrying it out like that sucks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:20): also, the technical correction process was a bad joke
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:20): because it's unreasonable to try to fix a spec of that size at that point with that schedule
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:21): and it's also unreasonable to ask the whole world to engage in barn-raising and fixing the spec
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (15:23): personally, I see this as yet another nail in the coffin for desktop-centric document formats
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:23): personally, I'd prefer ODF rewritten in the "5" style with proper processing requirements
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (15:24): why not HTML instead?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:24): I wouldn't be surprised if ODF5 would be the size of OOXML or larger
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:25): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: HTML has a different level of abstraction compared to a spreadsheet
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:25): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: so supporting spreadsheet round-tripping would invoke things that Hixie thinks are anti-patterns
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (15:26): yes, but for presentations and text-like documents, plain HTML suffices
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (15:26): my point is still that I think these should be transparent web formats
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (15:27): well ODF could be served over the web
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (15:27): it's just another format
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (15:27): IIRC there is or was a Firefox addon to read ODF.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (15:27): https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/1888
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:27): ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee: ODF is not streamable over HTTP
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (15:27): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: You mean no progressive load?
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (15:28): Well, progressive load is a nice to have. Not sure it's crucial though.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:29): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: HTML plus CSS is too powerful for general import into the Word/PowerPoint UI paradigms
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:29): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: so you'd need to have a profile
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:29): and profiles suck, too
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:30): there are lots and lots of abstraction level mismatches both ways between HTML+CSS and the de facto office suite feature set
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:37): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: Better get started on ISO5
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (15:38): well, I no longer regard (and again, highly personal opinion) ISO as a standards body
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:39): When even China manages to get the no vote right, it's quite embarrassing for Norway
